extendedInfo.description: S.M.T.H. (Send Me To Heaven) is a sport game. Player throws his phone as high as he can. The higher, the better. The phone registers the height and uploads result to leader boards. World Top 10, Week Top 10 and Day Top 10 lists are available. SAFETY FIRST: Be careful not to injure yourself or others. Be always aware that there is enough space above you and around you. WARNING: Throwing a smartphone high into the air may result in both damage to the smartphone, property and/or personal injury. Author and distributor of S.M.T.H. is not liable for any damages or injuries arising out of playing the S.M.T.H. game.HINTS: Avoid rotations in the air. Rotating phones can give wrong results. Every phone is different, so it needs a different treatment. Start to throw your phone gently about 20 cm, find the way which works for you and increase the height gradually. Developing skills is the part of the game!NOTE: Game works only on ARMv7 phones.Q&A:Q: I keep getting result 0 meters even if I toss my phone high. Why?A: Evey type of phone behaves differently as sensors are differently implemented. In most cases the problem is caused by rotations in air, which generate G-force. Throwing phone without rotations can help. Other common problem is that people shake phone before throwing and 0 is actually generated even before the phone flies. Solution is to throw phone gently, slowly, avoid rotations. Start with low height (around 20 cm), increase the height gradually. learn proper skills. Master your tool. Become champion!Q: I want to change my nickname. How?A: Uninstall S.M.T.H. App and install it again. You will be asked to pick your name again. Q: How can somebody throw the phone over 40 meters?A: I received some photographs. I don't want to pubish them as I wouldn't recommend to anyone to try that. It's not a safe practice. Q: I still keep getting 0 meters result. What's wrong?A: It's your technique or bad sensors in your phone. Try following: Be sure that S.M.T.H. is the only App running on your phone. Place your phone on your palm, screen up. SLOWLY move your hand down. STOP for a moment. SMOOTHLY throw your phone up in air about 50 cm from your hand, avoiding any rotation. let it land on your palm, screen still UP. Still 0 meters? Try another phone, sorry. Q: I am getting the same result again and again, it's below 1 meter. A: Try following: Be sure that S.M.T.H. is the only App running on your phone. Place your phone on your palm, screen up. SLOWLY move your hand down. STOP for a moment. SMOOTHLY throw your phone up in air about 50 cm from your hand, avoiding any rotation. let it land on your palm, screen still UP. Still the same result? Try another phone, sorry. Post photos and videos of your attempts: https://www.facebook.com/S.M.T.H.gameCopyright Â© 2012 - 2013 Petr Svarovsky

reviews.title: You will break your phone.
reviews.comment: \"Ha ha!\" you think. \"I\'m in a carpeted room, and can play SMTH with impunity!\" You cannot. There are no doubt tables and other hard surfaces elsewhere in the room, and you will find a way to throw your phone onto them. Then your phone will be broken\342\200\224perhaps obviously, perhaps in a subtle, irreproducible, and impossible-to-diagnose manner. Delivers excellently on its promise.
reviews.author: Paul Fisher

reviews.title: Hella dope game
reviews.comment: This game is great. I threw it 50 meters in the air but my neighbor who is a misfit midget racked my privates, took my phone and ran. He didn\'t even submit my score. Then the little Djebrone moved away cause he thought he could hide. But I found him and took my phone back #yolo
reviews.author: Daniel Robison

reviews.title: Eddie Tam, iOS version was rejected. Hilarious app anyway.
reviews.comment: Apple said the app was \"encouraging behavior that could result in damage to the user\'s device,\" so they banned it, but Android got it somehow.  But anyway, this app was HILARIOUS, I always play this app on my bed, just in case, because next thing you know, SNAP!
reviews.author: Isiah Rookwood

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Great game to play for your drunk enemies, boss, co-workers.. What happened to the iOS version? Is there some way for Apple phones to get it?
reviews.author: Eddie Tam

reviews.title: Cool Game!
reviews.comment: Very fun to play. I think that when you see in the leader board that people have >20 meters they are tossing their phone in the air and having it land on something soft like a bed.

reviews.title: Best game ever
reviews.comment: Literally the best game I\'ve ever played

reviews.comment: This is a great app! Look for the next app called Send Me To Hell - the winning score displays the highest temperature!

reviews.title: Perfection
reviews.comment: Installed this app earlier today, went in for blood work later on and have been diagnosed with HIV. 5/5 great app

reviews.comment: They should really let people follow their friends so that you can compete against your friends for the highest score (like they do in foursquare). If they had that, this app would be perfect.
